intro: Oenothera polymorpha var. brachysepala, commonly known as the short-sepaled evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces capsules that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This variety is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for nocturnal pollinators.
